addressleaf.section:
To my L. T
re
r 28 July 1594

page.lettertext:
fol.172r
1594 28 July To the L. T
re
r
May it please yo
r
good L. I reported in my
last
the 21 of this moneth
e answear of
e
states
to
her
Ma
ties
demaunde for their assistance by sea: wher
eto I
finde them by their speeches very throughly disposed,
and I doubt not all of their speedy perfourmance.
They doe attend altogether upon her Hig
es
precise
and
final resolution, w
t
out
e w
ch
they will not make
any present preparation, for
e reasons alleaged
in
my former to yo
r
L. and because
ei sawe
at those de-
maundes w
ch
were delivered
M
r
Caron
e 15 of
this
moneth, were then
e same day countermaunded ag
ain,
whereby remaining uncertaine of her Ma
ties
inten
tion
they knowe not howe to frame
e course of their p
rovi-
sion. Nevertheles I doe alwaies assure them,
that they
shall have notice of it, assoone as is needefull. I
am also
earnest w
t
them not onely to doe
at, w
ch
was requ
ired of
M
r
Caron, by those forsaid demaundes, but to exte
nd the
particulars to some greater proportion, w
ch
I am
cer-
tainly persuaded they will accomplishe in good
sort,
to her Hig
es
contentation. Moreover I suppos
e, that
sith they have determined as I am informed, [to]
[that]
the newe Englishe companies,
at serve in their pay,
[to the]
number of 8 enseignes, w
ch
were 13 at
e first,
and
they may be like-
wise induced by
her Ma
ties
intreatie
to send them all to-
wardes
Bre st
,
continue them there in
e pay of these contreis, for
the time
of
e enterprise. W
ch
I signifie to yo
r
L. as my p
rivat
persuasion, not omitting any meanes
at I can use
in that
regard, or in any other
at I
shall knowe,
can learne,
for
e ad
van-
cement of
e service.
And so I take my humble l
eave
From
e Hage. July 28 1594.
Yo
r
L. most humble at commaundem
t
. Tho. Bodley
